com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.server.adapter

Interface Check

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckImpl, FlagExtractionCheck

    public interface Check
    The Check represents a submitted check request to an Acrolinx Server. It could be submitted via CheckAdapter.check(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.CheckSettings, com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.extraction.CheckInformation, com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.DocumentCheckSettings)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Check NULL
      The NULL object of a check.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Cancels the currently running check, or nothing if there is no check in progress.
      int getCheckId() 
      CheckResult getCheckResult()
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckResult getCheckResult(CheckResultTransferMethod checkResultTransferMethod)
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor)
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor, CheckResultTransferMethod checkResultTransferMethod)
      This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished.
      CheckStatus getStatus()
      Returns the CheckStatus of the currently running document check, or a check status with the state NO_ONGOING_CHECK if no check is currently in progress.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final Check NULL
        The NULL object of a check. No external connection will be established.

    • Method Detail

      • cancel

        void cancel()
        Cancels the currently running check, or nothing if there is no check in progress. This method is thread-safe.

      • getStatus

        CheckStatus getStatus()
        Returns the CheckStatus of the currently running document check, or a check status with the state NO_ONGOING_CHECK if no check is currently in progress. This method is thread-safe.
        Note: It is smarter to use a ProgressMonitor.
        Returns:
        the current checking status

      • getCheckId

        int getCheckId()

      • getCheckResult

        CheckResult getCheckResult()
                           throws CheckFailedException
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to use an ProgressMonitor and one of the other getCheckResult methods.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException

      • getCheckResult

        CheckResult getCheckResult(CheckResultTransferMethod checkResultTransferMethod)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to use an ProgressMonitor and one of the other getCheckResult methods.
        Parameters:
        checkResultTransferMethod - The used CheckResultTransferMethod to receive the CheckResult.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception

      • getCheckResult

        CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to set ProgressMonitor.isCanceled().
        Parameters:
        monitor - The ProgressMonitor displaying the current state of the check. It supports also the possibility to cancel the check.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception

      • getCheckResult

        CheckResult getCheckResult(ProgressMonitor monitor,
                         CheckResultTransferMethod checkResultTransferMethod)
                           throws CheckFailedException
        This call is blocking and waiting until the check has finished. While blocking it is also possible to cancel the check with cancel() from another thread, but is smarter to set ProgressMonitor.isCanceled().
        Parameters:
        monitor - The ProgressMonitor displaying the current state of the check. It supports also the possibility to cancel the check.
        checkResultTransferMethod - The used CheckResultTransferMethod to receive the CheckResult.
        Returns:
        The CheckResult when the Check is in on of the final states.
        Throws:
        CheckFailedException - the check failed exception
